thread.title: Canadian Oil Sands Evaluates Selling Some of Its Production Stream
thread.title_full: Canadian Oil Sands Evaluates Selling Some of Its Production Stream - WSJ

author: Ben Dummett and Chester Dawson
title: Canadian Oil Sands Evaluates Selling Some of Its Production Stream
text:
Canadian Oil Sands Ltd., one of Canada’s largest producers of crude, is looking into selling some of its future production amid low crude oil prices and a growing debt load.
Canadian Oil Sands owns 37% of the Syncrude oil-sands mining consortium, one of the country’s largest producers of crude from the Alberta oil sands. Production snags at Syncrude’s operations and oil prices that recently fell to six-year lows have hit Canadian Oil Sands particularly hard because the Syncrude project is its only producing asset.
